alert.note: Alert for Greenwood; Newberry; Saluda (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 20 at 10:15PM EDT until June 25 at 12:31PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Columbia SC has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in South Carolina... Saluda River At Chappells affecting Greenwood, Newberry and Saluda Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING TO EARLY SUNDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Saluda River At Chappells. * WHEN...From Wednesday morning to early Sunday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, Lowlands around and downstream from Chappells become flooded. Cattle grazing river bottomland should be moved to higher ground. At 16.0 feet, Extensive farmland and river bottomland around and downstream from Chappells become flooded. At 18.0 feet, The Saluda River Campground including the Campground Store downstream from Chappells becomes flooded. Campers should move to higher ground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:15 PM EDT Tuesday the stage was 5.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage Wednesday morning to a crest of 16.9 feet early Friday morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Saturday afternoon. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - http://www.floodsafety.noaa.gov &&
info.instruction: Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and take action if necessary. Flooded roadways are nearly impossible to see at night. Avoid traveling in this area. Turn around, don`t drown. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Wednesday morning at 1015 AM EDT.
